text: The 2002 European Karate Championships, the 37th edition, was held in Tallinn, Estonia from May 2 to 4, 2002 ==Medallists== ===Men's Competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Luca Valdesi | Lucio Maurino | Stephane Marie Manuel Rodriguez Toquero |- | Kumite -60 kg | Cécil Boulesnane | Francesco Ortu | Borislav Ivanov David Luque Camacho |- | Kumite -65 kg | Alexandre Biamonti | Andrea Calzola | Marco Caamano Jason Ledgister |- | Kumite -70 kg | Haldun Alagas | Anthony Boelbaai | Messaoud Hammou Eki Luukka |- | Kumite -75 kg | Iván Leal Reglero | Salvatore Loria | Anton Gavrilov Konstantinos Papadopoulos |- | Kumite -80 kg | Denis Muhović | Daniël Sabanovic | Ewan Robb Davin Pack |- | Kumite +80 kg | Seydina Balde | Leon Walters | David Benetello Aleksandr Guerunov |- | Kumite Open | Serafin Blanco Granes | Zeynel Celik | Predrag Stojadinov Aleksandr Guerunov |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | * * * Michael Mack Christian Esni Benjamin Wolf |- | Kumite | | | * * * |} ===Women's competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Petra Nova | Myriam Szkudlarek | Sabrina Buil Miriam Cogolludo de la Herras |- | Kumite -53 kg | Nadia Mecheri | Estefania Garcia Romo | Kora Knühmann Evdoxia Kosmidou |- | Kumite -60 kg | Noeila Frenadenz Alonso | Milica Ilcikova | Nathalie Chereau Nathalie LeRoy |- | Kumite +60 kg | Laurence Fischer | Tania Weekes | Tessy Scholtes Snežana Pantić |- | Kumite Open | Yildiz Aras | Roberta Mita | Nathalie Leroy Cristin Feo Gomez |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | |- | Kumite | | | |} ==References== ==External links== * Karate Records - European Championship 2002 2002 Category:International sports competitions hosted by Estonia European Karate Championships European championships in 2002 Category:Sports competitions in Tallinn Category:21st century in Tallinn Category:Karate competitions in Estonia Category:May 2002 sports events in Europe
title: 2002 European Karate Championships
